Lesson 1: Introduction to GIS for Urban Planning

This lesson comprises of two sections. First, the motivation, theory and practice of urban planning will be discussed. The urban planning and management of Singapore will be discussed in this section too. The second section discusses the fundamental of Geographic Information Systems (GIS).
Published

November 21, 2022

Lesson Outline

Course Overview

  • An Overview of Urban Planning
    • Theory and philosophy of urban planning
    • Practice of urban planning
    • Urban planning and management in Singapore
  • Introduction to GIS
    • Basic concept of a GIS
    • System view of a GIS
    • GIS in the context of Smart Nation

Lesson Slides and Hands-on Notes

  • Lesson slide in html format.
  • Hands-on Exercise in html format.

Readings

Core Readings

  • Urban Planning
  • What Is GIS?
  • Geographic Information Systems and Urban Planning
  • How GIS technology helps in Smart City growth?

Addition Readings

Urban Planning

  • Urban Planning
  • Chapter 2: Re-Examining Singapore’s Urban Planning and Governance Framework in Planning Singapore: The Experimental City. This book is available in digital form in smu library.
  • Shatkin, G (2014) “Reinterpreting the Meaning of the ‘Singapore’ Model: State Capitalism and Urban Planning”, International Journal of Urban and Regional Research, Vol. 38, Issue 1, pp. 116-137.

GIS

  • Chapter 6: Geographic Information Systems of Springer Handbook of Geographic Information

  • Chapter 20: Planning of Springer Handbook of Geographic Information

  • What is Geographic Information Systems (GIS)?

  • See What Others Can’t

  • GIS: The Intelligent Nervous System

  • GIS - Mapping Common Ground

All About QGIS

  • 2. Introducing GIS of A Gentle Introduction to GIS.
  • QGIS User Guide. Chapter 3-9.
  • 2. Module: Creating and Exploring a BasicMapQGIS Training Manual of QGIS Training Manual
